body:
For your review.
There should another method to create DataFrame from numpy series which has no index.

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22781?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [1c113db...f0ed68d](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22781?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Hi,

  x2 is a ndarrays of 5 x 5. When I assign it to df['B'], only the first
column of x2 is included and there is warning whatsoever. Is this feature
documented?

On Fri, Sep 21, 2018 at 5:18 PM Joris Van den Bossche <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@jorisvandenbossche* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In doc/source/dsintro.rst
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22781#discussion_r219434319>:
>
> >
>  The result will be a DataFrame with the same index as the input Series, and
>  with one column whose name is the original name of the Series (only if no other
>  column name provided).
>
> +.. ipython:: python
> +
> +   df = pd.DataFrame()
> +   df
> +   x1 = pd.Series([1,2,3,4], index=[1,2,3,4])
> +   x1
> +   df['A'] = x1
> +   df
> +   x2 = pd.Series([5,5], index=[1, 3])
> +   x2
> +   df['B'] = x2
>
> There is already a section in this file about adding columns:
> http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/dsintro.html#column-selection-addition-deletion
>
> —
